FuncDef:
The nat alarm port-number user enable command enables the log and trap functions for the port usage of NAT users.
The undo nat alarm port-number user enable command restores the default configuration.
By default, the log and trap functions for the port usage of NAT users are disabled.
CLIs: nat alarm port-number { log | trap } [ load-balance ] user enable
undo nat alarm port-number { log | trap } [ load-balance ] user enable

ParaDef.Info:
Enables or disables the log alarm function for NAT user port usage.
-

Enables or disables the alarm function for the port usage of NAT users.
-

Examples: [*HUAWEI-nat-instance-cpe1] nat alarm port-number log user enable
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To monitor the port usage of NAT users, run the nat alarm port-number enable command to enable the log and trap functions for the port usage of NAT users.
Precautions
This command cannot be run after the vsm on-board-mode enable command is run.
